data.title: Quakers out front at Star Trax Night Run
meta_keywords: Quakers out front at Star Trax Night Run
data.meta_description: SALEM — The Salem High School girls runners are not resting on their laurels.   Salem incoming seniors Maggie Hopple and Maggie Hall — who ran on the Quaker
data.text:
SALEM — The Salem High School girls runners are not resting on their laurels.

Salem incoming seniors Maggie Hopple and Maggie Hall — who ran on the Quakers’ state runner-up 3200-meter relay team two months ago — were the top two females at the 31st annual Star Trax 5K Night Run on Saturday.

There were 333 finishers in the popular 3.1-mile race through the streets of Salem.

Hopple was first in 18 minutes, 54.4 seconds. Hall, the 2022 race champion, was second for the second straight year in 20:00.2.

Former Canfield High School and Mount Union standout Mack Mettille, 27, of Vail, Colorado, topped the men’s race in 16:08.6. Carson Klase of Homeworth was second in 16:27.3.

Proceeds from the event go to the Salem X-Tra Mile Club, which benefits the Salem cross country and track programs.

OPEN MEN

1. Mack Mettille (27, Vail, Colo.) 16:08.6

2. Carson Klase (17, Homeworth) 16:27.3

3. Lucas Sokol (17, Lake Milton) 16:35.7
